title: Sensex falls as oil companies slip; Vedanta hits over 10-month low
text:
May 23, 2018 / 7:19 AM / Updated 39 minutes ago Sensex, Nifty fall, oil stocks top drag Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
(Reuters) - Indian shares fell on Wednesday, dragged by energy stocks such as Hindustan Petroleum Corp Ltd and Oil and Natural Gas Corp Ltd (ONGC) on rising concern that the government may ask state-owned oil firms to share the burden of higher petrol and diesel prices. A broker reacts while trading at his computer terminal at a stock brokerage firm in Mumbai, August 24, 2015. REUTERS/Danish Siddiqui/Files
The broader NSE Nifty closed 1.01 percent lower at 10,430.35, while the benchmark BSE Sensex fell 0.88 percent to 34,344.91. Both the indexes fell over 1 percent in the last hour of trading.
Hindustan Petroleum declined nearly 8 percent, while ONGC dropped 5.3 percent.
Vedanta Ltd fell 6.4 percent to its lowest close since June 30, 2017, after an Indian court halted the proposed expansion of Vedanta Resources Plcâ€™s copper smelter in the southern state of Tamil Nadu. On Tuesday, 11 people were killed when police fired on protesters seeking closure of the plant on environmental grounds. Reporting by Krishna V Kurup in Bengaluru; Editing by Subhranshu Sahu
